item.title: Singaporean IT leaders are concerned that a shortage of skills could impede the progress of the Smart Nation initiative
item.description:
93% of Singaporean Chief Information Officers (CIOs) are worried that Singapore lacks the IT talent pool needed to successfully implement Smart Nation initiatives. Six out of 10 CIOs believe Smart Nation initiatives will lead to more IT jobs, and 53% believe these initiatives will boost average IT salaries. New independent research* commissioned by specialized recruiter Robert Half reveals that over 9 in 10 (93%) Singaporean IT leaders are concerned about the lack of readily available IT talent in Singapore to build a Smart Nation-ready workforce...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/singaporean-it-leaders-are-concerned-that-a-shortage-of-skills-could-impede-the-progress-of-the-smart-nation-initiative/
